text: The Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration was an era in the exploration of the continent of Antarctica. It began at the end of the 19th century, and ended after the First World War.Smith, p. 414The historian Aant Elzinga gives the much later date of 1945, considering World War II to be the turning point in Antarctic research. During the Heroic Age, the Antarctic region became the focus of international attention from ten countries.Barczewski, pp. 19–20.Huntford, p. 691 – "before machines took over." Both the geographic and magnetic South Poles were reached for the first time during the Heroic Age. ==References== Category:History of Antarctica Category:Exploration
title: Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration
